attributes.action: 306 soldiers shot at dawn in the Great War posthumously be awarded their medals
attributes.additional_details:
In 2018 I with a over 250,000 volunteers handwrote the Rank, Name & Date of every British & Commonwealth Soul lost during WW1.
Including the 306 shot at dawn.
The total souls lost is staggering 1,117,635 poppies were handwritten to create the Poppy of Honour, a steel & glass Memorial to remember them all collectively.
More information about the Memorial: poppyofhonour.org.uk
attributes.background:
The 306 soldiers shot at dawn to be awarded posthumously their medals, 1914 Star, War Medal and Victory Medal.
Their Names to be added to the rolls of Honour and their Names added to the War Memorials in their locality.

rejection.details:
The Government will only accept individual nominations, not petitions, so we can’t publish your petition.

To submit a nomination for an honour, visit: http://www.gov.uk/honours/

Decisions about changes to local war memorials are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.
